name: Holiday Shaved Brussels Sprout Salad
description: Brussels sprout salad is the ultimate crowd pleaser. It’s deliciously crunchy, sweet & salty. Paired with the perfect tangy lemon vinaigrette. It’s the perfect addition to your holiday menu.

recipe_ingredient.note: 1/3 cup pomegranate seeds or dried cranberries
recipe_ingredient.display: 1/3 cup pomegranate seeds or dried cranberries

recipe_ingredient.note: 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese, plus more to garnish
recipe_ingredient.display: 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese, plus more to garnish

recipe_instructions.text: First, make an entire batch of our lemon vinaigrette so it’s ready to dress the salad. Then move on to preparing the salad.
Heat a skillet (I prefer a cast iron skillet) over medium heat and add the pine nuts to the pan. Toast the nuts until they are golden, about 3-5 minutes. Remove the nuts from the pan and set aside.
Add the bacon to the same skillet and cook until it’s crisp about 6-8 minutes. Remove the bacon from the pan and set it aside. Pour the bacon grease into a small bowl and set aside.
Add the Brussels sprouts, apple, onion, pomegranate seeds, Parmesan cheese, and scallions to a large bowl and set aside.

Pour a half batch of Lemon vinaigrette into the same bowl with the bacon grease and maple syrup. Whisk until well combined. Taste the vinaigrette and adjust the seasoning to your taste (add a little more maple syrup if you want it sweeter).
Pour the vinaigrette over the salad and toss to combine. Taste the salad and season with salt and pepper to taste. If you want, you can also add more vinaigrette to taste.
Cover the salad and refrigerate for a couple of hours before serving.
When you’re ready to serve, crumble the bacon on top along with the pine nuts and shaved Parmesan, and enjoy!

The salad will last in the fridge for 2-3 days. If you're meal-prepping, You can certainly wait to dress the salad. But I recommend making the salad as instructed and making sure to leave the bacon and pine nuts out until you’re ready to eat. Dressing the salad ahead of time is a plus because the dressing will help tenderize and flavor the brussels sprouts as the salad sits in the fridge.
